section.para: The Liquidity function allows you to effectively manage the transfer of cash in your cash pool to the various departments or verticals in your organisation and optimise the use of funds.

section.title: Liquidity - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Liquidity function, select Cash Services > Liquidity from the tool bar.

section.title: Functions

important.para: This section is applicable only when property "liquidity.back.office.ktp" is set to "False".

section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: To access the existing sweep agreements fetched from the back office and view the linked instructions, schedules and execution results.
To allow the user to perform simulation and transfer actions for an agreement

important.para: This section is applicable only when property liquidity.back.office.ktp is set to 'False'.

section.para: This section describes the Manage Sweep Agreement function and the forms it uses.

section.title: Manage Sweep Agreement
section.para: To inquire Sweep Agreements and details in the system, select the Manage Sweep Agreement option from the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Liquidity page.

section.title: Inquire Agreement Details
section.para: Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Agreement Code, Agreement Name, Bank, Customer ID, Structure Type, Agreement Start Date, Agreement End Date, or Agreement Status fields. The list is not displayed until search criteria has been entered and the Search button has been clicked. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: Liquidity - Options

important.para: This section is applicable only when property "liquidity.back.office.ktp" is set to "True".

section.para: In the left side navigation menu, you can view the options provided for Liquidity.
The following option is available for Liquidity.

listitem.para: To access and edit existing pooling structures that is linked to the Back Office, and to create new pooling structures.

section.title: Liquidity - Pooling Structures

important.para: This section is applicable only when property "liquidity.back.office.ktp" is set to "True".

section.para: To access the list of liquidity structures in the system, select the Pooling Structures option from the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Liquidity page.

A set of initial details must be supplied through the first screen displayed. A number of search fields can be completed to limit the search for the required information. Enter the search criteria and click the Search button. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The table below provides description for the details required in the search fields.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Enter the code given to the pooling structure to search for. The code might be data coming in from the Back Office.
Enter the description of the pooling structure to search for.
Select the effective to and from date range of pooling structures to search for.
Select the type of status that the pooling structure is in to search for. Select asterisk to display records for all status types.

note.para: This search criteria is available only if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Select the type of actor that the pooling structure is linked to from Maker and Checker. Select asterisk to display records for all actor types.

note.para: This search criteria is available only if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: The columns returned in the list of liquidity structures are described in the table below.

Field
Description
Code
Displays the unique code to identify the pooling structure. This information might have been derived from the Back Office.
Description
Displays the description of the code providing additional information.
Effective Date
Displays the date the pooling structure is effective in the system.
Status
Indicates the status of the pooling structure based on the operations pending for the maker or checker.
This column is displayed only if maker-checker functionality is enabled.
Maker User
Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.
This column is displayed only if maker-checker functionality is enabled.
You can edit an existing item by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. For more details on editing a pooling structure, refer to the section Modify Pooling Structure in this document. You can view the pooling structure details by clicking the View
icon.

You can copy a pooling structure from an existing structure by clicking the Copy
icon. For more details, refer to the section Copy Pooling Structure From Existing Structure in this document.

You can cancel a pooling structure by clicking the Cancel
icon or approve by clicking the Action
icon. These icons are available if maker-checker is enabled for your profile.

section.title: Modify Pooling Structure
section.para: The editing of the pooling structure consists of the section for the structure details and the list of balancing groups. The list of balancing groups contains subgroups and accounts, and is accessible through a system of cascading popups.

section.title: Structure Details
section.para: This section displays identification and valid period details for the pooling structure. The table below provides descriptions for the fields here.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Displays the unique code to identify the pooling structure. This information might have been derived from the Back Office. This field is editable.
Displays the description entered for the pooling structure's code. This field is editable.
Displays the date the pooling structure is effective in the system. This field is editable. You can click on the date picker to edit this field.

section.title: List of Balancing Groups
section.para: This section lists the balancing groups for the pooling structure. You can define the rules for transfer of funds between your accounts here. The table below provides descriptions for the columns here.

entry.para: Field
Description
Displays the unique code to identify the balancing group.
Displays the description entered for the balancing group.
Displays the frequency of the pooling to be applied to the balancing group.
Displays the date type to be considered for the balancing group based on either value type or accounting type.
Displays the default currency of the balancing group.

Displays the minimum amount to be retained in the account. Any amount exceeding this value is considered for pooling and can be transferred automatically to your other linked accounts on fulfillment of certain other conditions configured by you.

Displays the value to be considered for rounding-off of the pooling transactions. For example, if you would like to transfer in denominations of hundred, you could enter 100 in this field. Once the threshold is reached for the minimum, the system considers the next condition and transfers in multiples of hundreds only. Any balance amount that doesn't reach multiples of hundred is retained until the balance reaches the multiple of hundred and the pooling is applied.
Displays the order that the system should consider the balancing group for pooling.

section.para: You can add a group by clicking on the Add Group button by scrolling to the bottom of the screen. The Add Balancing Group popup appears.

You can edit an existing item by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. On clicking edit, the Edit Balancing Group popup appears.

important.para: Once you have completed your entries for the pooling structure on the various forms and popups that are described further in this topic, you can use the action buttons at the bottom of the form to perform the actions described in the table below.
